title: What are the most thugged-out, rap songs of all time? - Quora

response.answer_text: This might fall more under the thug-nasty category, but I'm gonna go with Easy-E "Gimme that Nut" Also, almost anything from Oakland's Hyphy movement-- things by Mac Dre, E-40, Dem Hoodstarz, Traxamillion, Too $hort, etc Examples based on what's available on Youtube: "Sideshow" by Traxamillion featuring Too $short and Mistah FAB - also includes some nice footage of  actual sideshows happening in Oakland; you cruise around International Blvd at 3am enough and you'll run into one--not as often as 5 or 8 years  ago but it's still happenin'http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h4d7UwaNrIQ "Get Stupid" by Mac Dre - lots of references to the language/slang unique to Hyphyhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ktE5Vyds7Iw Mac Dre also did several popular collaborations with Keak da Sneak.. This is a good one, it's a remix but really quite fun to listen to:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EaXDr-e_EpU&feature=related "Tell me When to Go" by E-40 -- a reference to sideshows and "ghostriding the whip," a move popular and central to sideshows--the title of the song is asking bystanders and friends to tell him when to start riding as they view him hanging from the car.  Make sure you crank this up in your Tercel with the subwoofers in the trunk. See topic "Be authentic."http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2GZbaXdK8Js Dem Hoodstarz - Video Vixen http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BAc8yw981h4
